channel.title: Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor() VS. ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor
channel.description:
I'm working on a new tick system for a Private Server with a friend, he wants to use
[code=java] private static ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor threadpool = new ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor(6);
threadpool.scheduleAtFixedRate(new Server(), 0, 600, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS); [/code]
I want to use
[code=java] Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor().scheduleAtFixedRate(new Server(), 0, 600, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS); [/code]
Differences / explanation?
EDIT: Fuck, meant to put in General Programming. Move please?

item.title: Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor() VS. ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Jacob_, post:3, topic:442397”]There are three tasks I’m using to run using

Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor()

or

ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor()

So, I’m wasting three threads? Would there be persay a more advantage or disadvantage to loading these three tasks multi-threaded or single threaded?[/quote]if they’re easily parallelised tasks then running them in a 3-thread pool should be fine

Read full topic

item.title: Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor() VS. ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

notice

and how the Executor will use a thread pool containing 6 threads to execute scheduled tasks. if this executor is only going to ever execute 1 task (Server.run()) then it’s utterly pointless having 5 threads on standby waiting to execute tasks that won’t come

whereas

nominally says that it executes all scheduled tasks on a single thread, and since i assume you’ll only be ever using the executor to execute Server.run() then you’re better off using this.

Read full topic

item.title: Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor() VS. ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor
item.dc:creator: @Jacob5 Jacob_
item.description:
@Jacob5 wrote:

I’m working on a new tick system for a Private Server with a friend, he wants to use

private static ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor threadpool = new ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor(6);

threadpool.scheduleAtFixedRate(new Server(), 0, 600, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);

I want to use

Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor().scheduleAtFixedRate(new Server(), 0, 600, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);

Differences / explanation?
